Message.Title: The Real Reason for Microsoft's Woes
Message.Msg: An interesting read, but probably wrong, IMO. The author thinks through a mental image of ships driven by capricious winds. The ship that reaches the destination is the one that by chance is positioned to be driven to the destination by the winds at a particular moment. Individual merit and effort make no difference, he says -- a view that is not surprising in one with his cultural background. The only point one can agree with is that Microsoft is indeed in trouble, its future in doubt to say the least. http://www.forbes.com/sites/venkateshrao/2012/07/25/the-real-reason-for-microsofts-woes/?partner=yahoofeed

Topic.Title: The Real Reason for Microsoft's Woes

Additionally this IT ignoramous pretends that the mobil market is all sewn up and the contest is over - in spite of the fact that Microsoft is preparing the greatest OS software on the planet to be introduced in a couple of months. Never mind also that since the traditional hardware makers have laid down on the job for MSFT- MSFT is going to build its own phones and tablets. It has already gained a lot of exoperience doing this with X Box for instance. Topic.Title: Apple's hobby TV out sells signature Xbox!

Message.Msg: The Xbox 360 went on sale in 2005 and that's NOT A TYPO...2005!!! It's STILL selling like crazy. AAPL is a great company and competitor, but I think MSFT is going to give them a serious run for their money: Windows 8, Windows Tablets, Xbox 8, and, yes, Windows Phone 8 (not a lot of market share for Windows Phone yet, but it's a fantastic mobile OS). MSFT is gunning for the total experience: from the office to the living room and their recent products has been, quite frankly, awesome.

Topic.Title: Apple's hobby TV out sells signature Xbox!

Message.Msg: You are just flat out wrong. Windows 7 is the best operating system on the planet (and the fastest selling by far). Kinect is one of the most significant technology advancements ever--and it's utility goes way beyond Xbox. Office is "old hat"? WTF are you talking about? You obviously didn't read the last earnings report because Office killed it. I assume you've also never used a Windows Phone, but it's (Samsung Focus S) my primary phone and by far the best mobile device I've ever used. Nevermind MSFT's server and tools business, their cloud platform (Azure), and that they will likely dominate the living room for the forseeable future. Seems to me that you are the one with no talent.

Message.Title: Xbox sells less than Apple TV in Q3
Message.Msg: “Apple sold 1.3 million Apple TV devices during the June quarter, an increase of 170 percent over the same quarter a year ago,” Todd Bishop reports for GeekWire. “That still qualifies as a ‘hobby,’ according to Apple CEO Tim Cook, who disclosed the number in response to an analyst’s question on the company’s earnings conference call,” Bishop reports. “But here’s an interesting data point: Microsoft sold 1.1 million Xbox 360s worldwide during the same time period.”
